description.localized_desc: This normalizer parses common security audit logs from the Windows 2003 Event Log, localized in English. The following event IDs are covered: * 514 to 518 (system events), * 528 to 540 (logon events), * 560 to 565 (Object access events), * 576 to 578 (privileges use events)

Ce normaliseur traite les logs d'audit de sécurité communs du Journal d'Événéments de Windows 2003, en version anglaise. Les codes d'événements suivants sont normalisés : * 514 à 518 (événements du système), * 528 à 540 (événements de connexion), * 560 à 565 (événements d'accès aux objets), * 576 à 578 (événements d'utilisation des privilèges)

pattern.name: eventID-00514

description.localized_desc: An authentication package has been loaded by the Local Security Authority
Chargement d'un package d'authentification par l'Autorité Locale de Sécurité

pattern.text: An authentication package has been loaded by the Local Security Authority. This authentication package will be used to authenticate logon attempts. Authentication Package Name: _AUTHPACKAGE_

example.text: An authentication package has been loaded by the Local Security Authority. This authentication package will be used to authenticate logon attempts. Authentication Package Name: Kerberos

pattern.name: eventID-00515

description.localized_desc: A trusted logon process has registered with the Local Security Authority
Enregistrement auprès de l'autorité locale de sécurité d'un processus de connexion approuvée

pattern.text: A trusted logon process has registered with the Local Security Authority. This logon process will be trusted to submit logon requests. Logon Process Name: _PROCESSNAME_

example.text:
A trusted logon process has registered with the Local Security Authority. This logon process will be trusted to submit logon requests.
Logon Process Name: Schannel

pattern.name: eventID-00516

description.localized_desc: Internal resources allocated for the queuing of audit messages have been exhausted
Ressources allouées à la mise en file d'attente des messages d'audit épuisées

pattern.text: Internal resources allocated for the queuing of audit messages have been exhausted, leading to the loss of some audits. Number of audit messages discarded: _MDISCARDED_

example.text: Internal resources allocated for the queuing of audit messages have been exhausted, leading to the loss of some audits. Number of audit messages discarded: 132

pattern.name: eventID-00517

description.localized_desc: Le journal des événements de sécurité a été nettoyé

pattern.text: The audit log was cleared Primary User Name: _PUN_ Primary Domain: _PDOM_ Primary Logon ID: _PLID_ Client User Name: _CUN_ Client Domain: _CDOM_ Client Logon ID: _CLID_

example.text: The audit log was cleared Primary User Name: SYSTEM Primary Domain: NT AUTHORITY Primary Logon ID: (0x0,0x3E7) Client User Name: Administrator Client Domain: ACME Client Logon ID: (0x0,0x3F5C9)

pattern.name: eventID-00518

description.localized_desc: An notification package has been loaded by the Security Account Manager
Chargement d'un package de notification par le Gestionnaire des comptes de sécurité

pattern.text: An notification package has been loaded by the Security Account Manager. This package will be notified of any account or password changes. Notification Package Name: _NOTIFPACKAGE_

description.localized_desc: Le nom du package de notification

example.text: An notification package has been loaded by the Security Account Manager. This package will be notified of any account or password changes. Notification Package Name: scecli

pattern.name: eventID-00528-00540
pattern.text: Successful (?:Network )?Logon:? User Name: _USER_ Domain: _DOMAIN_ Logon ID: _LID_ Logon Type: _LOGONTYPE_ Logon Process: _LOGONPROCESS_ Authentication Package: _AUTHPACKAGE_ Workstation Name: _WORKSTATION_ Logon GUID: _LGUID_ Caller User Name: _CALLERUSER_ Caller Domain: _CALLERDOMAIN_ Caller Logon ID: _CID_ Caller Process ID: _CPID_ Transited Services: _TSERV_ Source Network Address: _SOURCEIP_ Source Port: _SOURCEPORT_

description.localized_desc: Le port source de la connexion

example.text:
Successful Logon:
User Name: Administrator Domain: W2003EN Logon ID: (0x0,0x64C2F) Logon Type: 7 Logon Process: User32 Authentication Package: Negotiate Workstation Name: W2003EN Logon GUID: - Caller User Name: W2003EN$ Caller Domain: WORKGROUP Caller Logon ID: (0x0,0x3E7) Caller Process ID: 532 Transited Services: - Source Network Address: 127.0.0.1 Source Port: 0

Successful Network Logon:
User Name: Administrator
Domain: ELM Logon ID: (0x0,0x558DD) Logon Type: 3 Logon Process: User32 Authentication Package: Negotiate Workstation Name: W2MS Logon GUID: {d39697e4-34a9-b3e0-f30a-d2ba517eb4a2} Caller User Name: - Caller Domain: - Caller Logon ID: - Caller Process ID: - Transited Services: - Source Network Address: 10.42.42.170 Source Port: 3165

pattern.name: eventID-00529_to_00537
pattern.text: Logon Failure: Reason: _REASON_ User Name: _USER_ Domain: _DOMAIN_ (?:Logon ID: _LID_ )?Logon Type: _LOGONTYPE_ Logon Process: _LOGONPROCESS_ Authentication Package: _AUTHPACKAGE_ Workstation Name: _WORKSTATION_ (?:Logon GUID: _LGUID_ )?Caller User Name: _CALLERUSER_ Caller Domain: _CALLERDOMAIN_ Caller Logon ID: _CID_ Caller Process ID: _CPID_ Transited Services: _TSERV_ Source Network Address: _SOURCEIP_ Source Port: _SOURCEPORT_

description.localized_desc: Le port source de la connexion

example.text: Logon Failure: Reason: Unknown user name or bad password User Name: Administrator Domain: W2003EN Logon Type: 7 Logon Process: - Authentication Package: Negotiate Workstation Name: MYWORKSTATION Caller User Name: - Caller Domain: - Caller Logon ID: - Caller Process ID: - Transited Services: - Source Network Address: 10.42.42.180 Source Port: 0

expectedTags.expectedTag: Unknown user name or bad password

pattern.name: eventID-00538
pattern.text: User Logoff: User Name: _USER_ Domain: _DOMAIN_ Logon ID: _LID_ Logon Type: _LOGONTYPE_

pattern.name: eventID-00560_00563_00565
pattern.text: Object Open(?: for Delete)?: Object Server: _OBJSERVER_ Object Type: _OBJTYPE_ Object Name: _OBJNAME_ Handle ID: _HANDLEID_ Operation ID: {_OPID_} Process ID: _PID_ (?:(?:Image File Name: _FILENAME_)|(?:Process Name: _PROCESSNAME_)) Primary User Name: _USER_ Primary Domain: _DOMAIN_ Primary Logon ID: _LOGONID_ Client User Name: _CLIENTUSER_ Client Domain: _CLIENTDOMAIN_ Client Logon ID: _CLID_ Accesses: _ACCESSES_ Privileges: _PRIVILEGES_(?: Properties: _PROPERTIES_)?(?: Restricted Sid Count: _SIDCOUNT_)?(?: Access Mask: _ACCESSMASK_)?

example.text: Object Open: Object Server: Security Object Type: Key Object Name: \REGISTRY\MACHINE\SYSTEM\ControlSet001\Services\Eventlog\Security Handle ID: 3240 Operation ID: {0,112580708} Process ID: 768 Image File Name: C:\WINDOWS\system32\services.exe Primary User Name: UserName Primary Domain: DomainName Primary Logon ID: (0x0,0x3E7) Client User Name: UserName Client Domain: DomainName Client Logon ID: (0x0,0x3E7) Accesses: Set key value Privileges: - Restricted Sid Count: 0

pattern.name: eventID-00562_564
pattern.text: (?:(?:Handle Closed)|(?:Object Deleted)): Object Server: _OBJSERVER_ Handle ID: _HANDLEID_ Process ID: _PID_ Image File Name: _FILENAME_

example.text: Handle Closed: Object Server: Security Handle ID: 1468 Process ID: 1688 Image File Name: C:\WINDOWS\system32\notepad.exe

pattern.name: eventID-00576

description.localized_desc: Privilèges spéciaux assignés à une nouvelle session

pattern.text: Special privileges assigned to new logon: User Name: _USER_ Domain: _DOMAIN_ Logon ID: _LOGONID_ (?:(?:Privileges)|(?:Assigned)): _PRIVILEGES_

description.localized_desc: The privileges, they can belong to the following list: * SeTcbPrivilege : act as part of the operating system * SeMachineAccountPrivilege: add workstations to domain * SeIncreaseQuotaPrivilege: adjust memory quotas for a process * SeBackupPrivilege: back up files and directories * SeChangeNotifyPrivilege: bypass traverse checking * SeSystemtimePrivilege: change the system time * SeCreatePagefilePrivilege: create a pagefile * SeCreateTokenPrivilege: create a token object * SeCreatePermanentPrivilege: create permanent shared objects * SeDebugPrivilege: debug programs * SeEnableDelegationPrivilege: enable computer and user accounts to be trusted for delegation * SeRemoteShutdownPrivilege: force shutdown from a remote system * SeAuditPrivilege: generate security audits * SeIncreaseBasePriorityPrivilege: increase scheduling priority * SeLoadDriverPrivilege: load and unload device drivers * SeLockMemoryPrivilege: lock pages in memory * SeSecurityPrivilege: manage auditing and security log * SeSystemEnvironmentPrivilege: modify firmware environment values * SeManageVolumePrivilege: perform volume maintenance tasks * SeProfileSingleProcessPrivilege: profile single process * SeSystemProfilePrivilege: profile system performance * SeUndockPrivilege: remove computer from docking station * SeAssignPrimaryTokenPrivilege: replace a process level token * SeRestorePrivilege: restore files and directories * SeShutdownPrivilege: shut down the system * SeSyncAgentPrivilege: synchronize directory service data * SeTakeOwnershipPrivilege: take ownership of files or other objects

Les privilèges, issus de la liste suivante : * SeTcbPrivilege : agir comme le système d'exploitation * SeMachineAccountPrivilege: ajouter un poste de travail au domaine * SeIncreaseQuotaPrivilege: ajuster les quotas mémoire d'un processus * SeBackupPrivilege: sauvegarder des fichiers et répertoires * SeChangeNotifyPrivilege: outrepasser les droits d'accès transverses * SeSystemtimePrivilege: changer l'heure système * SeCreatePagefilePrivilege: créer un fichier de pagination * SeCreateTokenPrivilege: créer un jeton * SeCreatePermanentPrivilege: créer des objets partagés permanents * SeDebugPrivilege: déboguer les programmes * SeEnableDelegationPrivilege: accorder la délégation à des ordinateurs et des comptes utilisateurs * SeRemoteShutdownPrivilege: forcer l'arrêt à distance * SeAuditPrivilege: générer des audits de sécurité * SeIncreaseBasePriorityPrivilege: augmenter la priorité d'exécution * SeLoadDriverPrivilege: charger et décharger des pilotes matériels * SeLockMemoryPrivilege: bloquer des pages en mémoire * SeSecurityPrivilege: gérer les logs d'audit et de sécurité * SeSystemEnvironmentPrivilege: changer les variables d'environnement de firmware * SeManageVolumePrivilege: réaliser des opérations de maintenance sur les volumes * SeProfileSingleProcessPrivilege: profiler un processus * SeSystemProfilePrivilege: profiler les performances système * SeUndockPrivilege: retirer un poste de travail de sa station d'accueil * SeAssignPrimaryTokenPrivilege: remplacer un token au niveau processus * SeRestorePrivilege: restaurer des fichiers et des répertoires * SeShutdownPrivilege: mettre le système à l'arrêt * SeSyncAgentPrivilege: synchroniser les données du service d'annuaire * SeTakeOwnershipPrivilege: prendre possession de fichiers

example.text: Special privileges assigned to new logon: User Name: Fred Domain: Acme Logon ID: (0x0,0x10591D) Assigned: SeBackupPrivilege SeRestorePrivilege SeDebugPrivilege SeChangeNotifyPrivilege SeRestorePrivilege SeDebugPrivilege SeChangeNotifyPrivilege

expectedTags.expectedTag: SeBackupPrivilege SeRestorePrivilege SeDebugPrivilege SeChangeNotifyPrivilege SeRestorePrivilege SeDebugPrivilege SeChangeNotifyPrivilege

pattern.name: eventID-00577
pattern.text: Privileged Service Called: Server: _SERVER_ Service: _SERVICE_ Primary User Name: _USER_ Primary Domain: _DOMAIN_ Primary Logon ID: _LOGONID_ Client User Name: _CLIENTUSER_ Client Domain: _CLIENTDOMAIN_ Client Logon ID: _CLID_ Privileges: _PRIVILEGES_

example.text: Privileged Service Called: Server: Security Service: - Primary User Name: Administrator Primary Domain: ELMW2 Primary Logon ID: (0x0,0x804C2) Client User Name: - Client Domain: - Client Logon ID: - Privileges: SeSystemtimePrivilege

pattern.name: eventID-00578

description.localized_desc: Appel à une opération privilégiée sur un objet

pattern.text: Privileged object operation: Object Server: _OBJSERVER_ Object Handle: _OBJHANDLE_ Process ID: _PID_ Primary User Name: _USER_ Primary Domain: _DOMAIN_ Primary Logon ID: _LOGONID_ Client User Name: _CLIENTUSER_ Client Domain: _CLIENTDOMAIN_ Client Logon ID: _CLID_ Privileges: _PRIVILEGES_

example.text: Privileged object operation: Object Server: EventLog Object Handle: 0 Process ID: 248 Primary User Name: W2DC$ Primary Domain: ELMW2 Primary Logon ID: (0x0,0x3E7) Client User Name: Administrator Client Domain: ELMW2 Client Logon ID: (0x0,0x804C2) Privileges: SeSecurityPrivilege
